content: How can I set True as the default value for a BooleanField in Django? Currently, the checkbox generated by the BooleanField is in an unchecked state by default and I want it to be checked.

To set `True` as the default value for a `BooleanField` in Django, you can use the `default` attribute when defining the field in your model. By setting `default=True`, the checkbox will be checked by default in forms generated from your model. Here's how you can do it:

```python
from django.db import models

class YourModel(models.Model):
    your_boolean_field = models.BooleanField(default=True)
```

With this configuration, when you create a new instance of `YourModel` using a form, the checkbox corresponding to `your_boolean_field` will be checked by default.

If you are using a Django form and want to ensure the checkbox is checked by default when rendering the form, you can also set the initial value for the form field:

```python
from django import forms
from .models import YourModel

class YourModelForm(forms.ModelForm):
    class Meta:
        model = YourModel
        fields = ['your_boolean_field']

    your_boolean_field = forms.BooleanField(initial=True)
```

This approach ensures that the checkbox is checked by default when the form is rendered, regardless of the default value set at the model level.
